items.label: Reading & Writing
items.text: Strong reading comprehension, vocabulary-in-context, grammar, and clarity of expression across short passages from literature, science, and social studies.

items.label: Math Skills
items.text: Conceptual understanding of algebra, advanced math, data analysis, geometry, and trigonometry with efficient problem-solving strategies.

items.label: Analytical Reasoning
items.text: Ability to interpret graphs, tables, charts, and real-world data to draw logical conclusions.

items.label: Time Management
items.text: Accuracy and speed across adaptive test modules with questions arranged from easier to harder.

items.label: College Admissions
items.text: Used by universities worldwide to assess college readiness and compare applicants from different education systems.

items.label: Scholarships
items.text: Higher SAT scores can unlock merit-based scholarships and financial aid opportunities.

items.label: Academic Readiness
items.text: Evaluates critical thinking, problem-solving, and literacy skills required for undergraduate studies.

items.label: Global Recognition
items.text: Accepted by thousands of colleges across the United States and internationally.
